result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha H Anderson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:09 AM Samantha H Anderson appeared in person.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Samantha H Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case, cites charges.  Atty Brewer acks rct of complaint.  Def waives formal reading of complaint.  Def is still waiving time limits for prelim hearing.  PTC to be set for 10/3 at 11:30 a.m.  Bond continues.  Adj.  9:12 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 08/10/2022:  Bail/Bond Review:  10:43 a.m.  Court calls case.  Michael Korpela presiding, CR is Kassie Beebe.  No complaint filed yet.  Heidi Brewer appears via Zoom on behalf of def who appears in person, in custody of ICJ.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Brewer states reasons for request of sig bond.  DA reiterates charges.  If Court entertaining sig bond, requests high sig bond.  Complaint should be filed in approx 7 days.  Init for 9/12 at 9:00 a.m.  Def indicates can appear via Zoom.  Court sets $5,000 sig bond.  All other conditions remain in place.  Also, def shall not leave the state except for medical appointments.  314 John Avenue, Superior, WI 54880 is new address.  Mention previously made of testing on demand provision.  Atty Brewer requests it be removed.  Was not on original bond.  Court addresses def re charges.  No testing on demand.  Reiterates condition to not leave state except for medical appts.  Adj. 10:55 a.m.  klr

ANDERSON, SAMANTHA:  9:34 a.m.  Bond hearing minutes:  9:34 a.m.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  P.C.  Statement given to Court.  Court states possible charges.  PD info given to def.  Court accepts PC statement.  Officer Colassacco sworn in, direct by Court.  Court finds PC.  Court explains P.C.  DA requests no possession or consumption of controlled substances, testing on demand.  No driving.  $1,000 cash bond.  Not to possess CTs.  Testing for controlled substances on demand.  Court sets $1,000 cash bond with conditions of no possession or use of CTs.  No marijuana.  Court explains prelim and time limits.  Def is unsure.  Def wants to waive T/L.  Court grants waiver.  Right preserved to have prelim.  Def to contact PD.  No questions.  Adj.  9:43 a.m.  klr
